programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: (2021) On International Women's Day, Kristen Bell and Kirby Howell-Baptiste conjure criminal hi-jinks from the apparently banal in Gita Pullapilly and Aron Gaudet's fact-based comic caper.

programme.title: Hustlers
programme.desc: (2019) Lorene Scafaria's fact-based caper. Jennifer Lopez leads a group of high-end strippers who turn the tables on sleazy blokes and stick it to the Man on International Women's Day.

programme.title: A Banquet
programme.desc: (2021) A screening of Ruth Paxton's thought-provoking body-horror on International Women's Day. Could a teenager who stops eating but stays the same weight be a mythical Japanese monster?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: (2010) Animated adventure. In the ogre's fourth feature-length escapade, Shrek makes an unwise bargain with Rumpelstiltskin. With the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz and Eddie Murphy.

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: (2011) Family comedy. Jim Carrey stars as a work-obsessed New York property developer whose life is turned upside down when he receives a crate containing six live penguins.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy sequel with Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow. There's trouble in store for the extended family when Dusty and Brad's fathers visit for Christmas.

programme.title: The Last Duel
programme.desc: (2021) Historical drama from director Ridley Scott. Trial by combat is the only option to save a noblewoman's honour. With Jodie Comer, Matt Damon, Adam Driver and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Blue Bayou
programme.desc: (2021) Justin Chon's poignant drama about a man of Korean descent who is threatened with deportation from the US even though he was adopted into an American family when he was three.

programme.title: The Gravedigger's Wife
programme.desc: (2021) Evocative drama following the struggles of a family in Djibouti. A gravedigger must find the funds to pay for his wife's life-saving surgery. In Somali/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Step Up: Ready to Drive
programme.desc: Sisters Mandy and Coco share a passion for cooking. They bought a caravan during lockdown with the dream of launching a food business. But after three years, the project remains incomplete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Outcast of the Islands
programme.desc: (1951) Director Carol Reed's drama. A disgraced trader finds a new life in a secretive trading village. However, his own greed soon brings trouble. With Trevor Howard and Ralph Richardson.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: (1956) Western with Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine, Rod Steiger and Valerie French. A cowboy is given a job by a rancher, sparking lethal jealousy in a colleague and desire in the boss's wife.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Desert Rats
programme.desc: (1953) Second World War drama featuring Richard Burton as the commander of Australian troops during the 1941 siege of Tobruk. Also starring Robert Newton and James Mason.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: (1984) Musical drama with Kevin Bacon. An unruly teen moves to a small town where dancing is banned. As more teens start misbehaving, can he change his elders' minds? Violence.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc: (2014) Action-comedy with Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson. A London teenager is introduced a secret society of immaculately dressed agents that exists to save the world.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: (1992) Thriller with Harrison Ford and Sean Bean. An ex-CIA agent foils an IRA assassination plot. But a vengeful IRA man follows him back to America.

programme.title: Primal
programme.desc: (2019) Action-packed thriller starring Nicholas Cage. When both animals and assassins are let loose on a cargo ship, it's up to veteran-turned-poacher Frank Walsh to save the day.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: The Smallest Show On Earth
programme.desc: (1957) Comedy with Bill Travers and Virginia McKenna as a couple who inherit a dilapidated fleapit cinema, along with its equally dilapidated staff: Peter Sellers, Margaret Rutherford.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: (1952) John Wayne stars in John Ford's comedy as a US boxer, retired to Ireland, who courts the fiery Mary Kate (Maureen O'Hara), despite her brother's (Victor McLaglen) violent objections.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle
programme.desc: (2017) Taron Egerton returns as the newest recruit to the stylish secret agency Kingsman for more ass kicking comedy action. A star-studded cast includes Julianne Moore and Elton John.

programme.title: Paul
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi comedy. On a road trip across the USA, two British UFO geeks (Simon Pegg and Nick Frost) make pals with a potty-mouthed alien (voiced by Seth Rogen). With Sigourney Weaver.

programme.title: Queenpins
programme.desc: (2021) On International Women's Day, Kristen Bell and Kirby Howell-Baptiste conjure criminal hi-jinks from the apparently banal in Gita Pullapilly and Aron Gaudet's fact-based comic caper.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by comedy couple Paul Merton and Suki Webster, along with presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle. Jonathan Moseley shows off some sustainable spring floristry and Tom Surgey brings a delicious selection of cheese and wine pairings to the barn in the Best of British feature

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents all the action from the Championship match at Fratton Park. Leeds are among the favourites to win the title, but they drew 3-3 when they met Pompey at Fratton Park in August. Callum Lang's penalty looked to have won it for Portsmouth in the second minute of stoppage time, but Brenden Aaronson was still able to rescue a point for United. With analysis from Stuart Dallas and Matt Taylor, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the final match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. England have bounced back from a loss away to Ireland in the opening round with single-point victories over both France and Scotland. They will be expecting a more comfortable victory against the Italians, who were thrashed 73-24 at home to France last time out, but the Azzurri's 22-15 win against Wales in round two shows they can be a threat on their day. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Maggie Alphonsi and Sergio Parisse, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Kyle Sinckler, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern present the grand finale, as the final three couples go head to head in a bid to lift the Dancing on Ice Trophy. Their routines include a dazzling showcase choreographed by Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean, who will also skate together on television for the final time ahead of their farewell tour, marking the end of an era for the duo. Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse complete the judging line up

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A vital clue leads the MIU to take a closer look at another of Hannah's family members, but when red tape stops the team in their tracks, Manning's frustrations at the lack of results reach an all-time high and he cuts corners to move the investigation forward. Elsewhere, Jenn's FLO relationship is in peril when her support for Steve goes too far, Chris faces the Ofsted inspectors, and Manning is left in hot water by another dead end

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. However, Barr refuses to confess to the crime, and sends out word for ex-military investigator Jack Reacher to clear his name. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieix's gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: On the menu this time are a zesty oxtail and shin curry, some spiced marinated barbecue prawns, and a tahini banana bread and butter pudding with its own candied bacon and pecan bourbon ice cream, before Nisha has a family recipe tasting in the evening

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan and a team of experts examine the latest horticultural trends for seasoned and aspiring gardeners alike. Alan showcases his early-blooming plants, Camilla Bassett-Smith visits the world's largest indoor rainforest to meet the team behind it, Claire Lowrie leads a houseplant masterclass for beginners, Anna Greenland answers a viewer's query on growing vegetables, and Errol Reuben Fernandes explores an inner-city community garden

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are partners Darren and Emma, father and daughter Neil and Bex, and engaged couple Norah and Dom

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Susan from Stoke-on-Trent, Jamahl from Birmingham, Ali from Corwen and Spencer from Kent pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon acts dishonestly, Steph's suspicions pique, and Sarah gets sad news

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Accusations fly in the aftermath of the crash, Betsy refuses to curtail her freedom because of Rob, Eileen catches Julie whispering with George, and Alya bids an emotional farewell to Yasmeen

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A new SIO is called in to lead the MIU team, who struggle to adapt to a new way of working, but are forced to accept the new regime to get fresh leads in Hannah's case. Meanwhile, Jenn must choose between her family and her job when an error in judgement gets Erin in hot water at work, and Julie's trust in Jenn is damaged when Craig is arrested

programme.title: Oscars Highlights
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross presents the best moments from the 97th Academy Awards ceremony at the Dolby Theatre in Ovation Hollywood, hosted by Conan O'Brien. The dark musical Emilia Prez leads the nominations with a total of 13, followed by Wicked and The Brutalist, which have 10 each. British actors up for acting gongs are Cynthia Erivo (Wicked), Ralph Fiennes (The Conclave) and Felicity Jones (The Brutalist), although if the Baftas are anything to go by, they face strong competition from their fellow nominees

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: Five women share their experiences of being deceived into intimate relationships with undercover police officers. Alison, Lisa and Helen were campaigners in their twenties when they first met their seemingly perfect boyfriends, but creepy clues emerged as their relationships developed. When all three women dug deeper, they discovered they had been spun a web of lies as their perfect activist boyfriends were state agents who had deceived them

programme.title: The Murder of Grace Millane: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. Featuring interviews with people who knew her or were involved with the investigation, with revealing police interview footage and CCTV

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: Five women share their experiences of being deceived into intimate relationships with undercover police officers. Alison, Lisa and Helen were campaigners in their twenties when they first met their seemingly perfect boyfriends, but creepy clues emerged as their relationships developed. When all three women dug deeper, they discovered they had been spun a web of lies as their perfect activist boyfriends were state agents who had deceived them

programme.title: The Murder of Grace Millane: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by comedy couple Paul Merton and Suki Webster, along with presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle. Jonathan Moseley shows off some sustainable spring floristry and Tom Surgey brings a delicious selection of cheese and wine pairings to the barn in the Best of British feature

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Leeds United (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents all the action from the Championship match at Fratton Park. Leeds are among the favourites to win the title, but they drew 3-3 when they met Pompey at Fratton Park in August. Callum Lang's penalty looked to have won it for Portsmouth in the second minute of stoppage time, but Brenden Aaronson was still able to rescue a point for United. With analysis from Stuart Dallas and Matt Taylor, commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, and reports from Aaron Paul

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the final match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. England have bounced back from a loss away to Ireland in the opening round with single-point victories over both France and Scotland. They will be expecting a more comfortable victory against the Italians, who were thrashed 73-24 at home to France last time out, but the Azzurri's 22-15 win against Wales in round two shows they can be a threat on their day. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Maggie Alphonsi and Sergio Parisse, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Kyle Sinckler, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its 10,000 jackpot
